title: Michigan hires Whittingham as HC on 5-year deal
content: Kyle Whittingham was hired as Michigan's next head football coach, signing a five-year deal, the school said on Friday night.

title: Raiders shut down DE Crosby, who leaves facility
content: The Raiders informed defensive end Maxx Crosby that he will sit out Sunday's matchup against the Giants because of a knee injury. After being told of the decision, Crosby left the team's facility.

title: Lakers' Reaves (calf strain) out at least 1 month
content: Los Angeles Lakers guard Austin Reaves is expected to miss at least a month because of a calf strain, the team announced Friday.

title: Packers rule out Love, will start Willis vs. Ravens
content: Packers quarterback Jordan Love has been ruled out for Saturday's game against the Ravens as he continues to deal with a concussion. Malik Willis will start for Green Bay.

title: Bills' Allen 'good to go' vs. Eagles after foot injury
content: Despite a right foot injury, Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen is set to play in Sunday's game against the Philadelphia Eagles and is not expected to have any limitations, per coach Sean McDermott.

title: Garrett eyes sack record vs. 'legendary' Rodgers
content: Defensive end Myles Garrett says it would be "special" to set the NFL's single-season sack record against "legendary" quarterback Aaron Rodgers when the Browns and Steelers square off Sunday in Cleveland.

title: Pats down 5 starters, but Henderson might play
content: The Patriots will be without five starters against the Jets, but there's still a chance rookie running back TreVeyon Henderson is available as he progresses through concussion protocol.

title: Sources: AD to miss a few games with groin strain
content: Mavericks star Anthony Davis has sustained a minor groin strain and is likely to miss a few games, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: üèÜ Pop-Tarts Bowl trophy: Behind the scenes
content: How the internet's favorite bowl took things to the next level by making its trophy a kitchen appliance.

content: Seahawks vs. Panthers. Jalen Hurts vs. Josh Allen. Picks, predictions and more for every remaining Week 17 game.

content: Here's the latest intel from around the league, including whether Joe Burrow wants out of Cincy and more.

title: Reasons for optimism and pessimism for all 10 NBA teams that played on Christmas
content: ESPN analyst Zach Kram picks two stats for the teams that played on Dec. 25, and breaks down why fans should be happy and worried about their title aspirations.

title: A reason (or two) to watch every one of this year's bowl games
content: With first-year success stories, chances at redemption and general silliness, bowl season always delivers.

title: How to bet Texans-Chargers and Ravens-Packers, plus DFS picks
content: The Texans can clinch a playoff spot against the Chargers, while the Ravens need a win against the Packers. Here are the odds, game picks, prop plays and daily fantasy tips for the games.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Young risers to watch on all 30 teams
content: From ROY and MIP races, our NBA insiders break down all 30 teams' young riser in this week's Power Rankings.

title: Ranking the biggest MLB Christmas week moves
content: Who says the offseason slows down for the holidays? Let's remember some free agent signings and trades.

title: Burrow gifts offensive linemen authentic dinosaur, bear and mammoth fossils for Christmas
content: Burrow's love of fossils gained national acclaim because of a clip from the Netflix series "Quarterback," where he was pumped to see fossils at Chicago's Field Museum.

title: Buzz: Lamar Jackson doubtful for Saturday; Jordan Love ruled out
content: Check your lineups as Lamar Jackson is doubtful to play on Saturday, while Jordan Love has been ruled out.

title: Tracking the NFL playoff picture: Updated chances to clinch open spots, win division titles
content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: Makeshift Man United scrap to win over Newcastle, offering hope as rough stretch approaches
content: Man United's win over Newcastle on Boxing Day may be Ruben Amorim's most satisfying yet as they overcame a depleted squad.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Atalanta to test Inter, AFCON pressures Morocco
content: What is Julien Laurens watching this weekend? Inter Milan getting tested by upstart Atalanta, and more action for Africa Cup of Nation hosts Morocco.

title: 36 NFL rookies reveal the one big lesson they learned this season
content: Tyler Shough, Isaac TeSlaa and Jalon Walker were among the 36 rookies who learned how humbling and challenging the NFL can be.

title: 'Mr. Eligible': The growing fraternity of NFL sixth offensive linemen
content: NFL teams are using sixth O-linemen in more plays this season, and we're highlighting, yep -- six of them.

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: What's new heading into second season of TGL
content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: World Junior Championship guide: Top contenders, key players to watch
content: The tournament starts Thursday, with the best under-20 players in hockey. Here are gold medal favorites, players set to break out.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want Gallagher loan, Atl√©tico want ‚Ç¨30m
content: Atl√©tico Madrid midfielder Conor Gallagher is the subject of interest from Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: How U.S. Soccer can grow the game with $100 million World Cup windfall
content: The U.S. Soccer Federation is expecting to earn $100 million from co-hosting next summer's World Cup, so how will that money be invested in the game?

title: The 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, ranked!
content: Here are the 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, as ranked by an expert panel of coaches, GMs and journalists.

title: Colton Herta's adaptation to F2 could define IndyCar's global reputation
content: Colton Herta left IndyCar for F2 in hopes of moving up to F1. Whether he succeeds could determine how the world views the American open-wheel series.

title: Row Over Digvijaya Singh's Throwback Pic Of PM Modi, Praise For BJP-RSS
content: Senior Congress leader Digvijay Singh has courted a fresh controversy with his praises for the BJP and its ideological parent, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS).

title: Madhya Pradesh BJP Leader Rams Car Into People Sitting Near Bonfire, 2 Dead
content: The car was allegedly being driven by Deependra Bhadauria, the BJP Youth Wing Vice President of its rural unit in Porsa.

title: AAP Announces Debut In Bhiwandi, Navi Mumbai Civic Polls
content: The AAP announced its maiden foray into the upcoming civic elections in Bhiwandi and Navi Mumbai, unveiling plans to field candidates on the maximum number of seats in both municipal corporations.

title: Ecuador Metro Suspended After Puppy Enters Tracks, Rescued After 24 Hours
content: A puppy was rescued early Thursday after it spent nearly 24 hours in the metro tunnels of Quito, Ecuador. The chase began Wednesday morning when the dog and a cat entered the subway tracks near the San Francisco station.

title: Mouse Births Pups After Return From Space Mission In China
content: Of the four mice involved in a recent mission aboard China's space station, one female has now successfully birthed healthy offspring on Earth, the Technology and Engineering Center for Space Utilization of the Chinese Academy of Sciences said.

title: Heatwaves, Wildfires, Droughts, Storms Cost World Over $120 Billion In 2025: Report
content: Heatwaves, wildfires, droughts, and storms cost the world more than $120 billion in 2025, according to a new report analysing the escalating cost of climate change.

title: Congress Holds High-Level Meet, Shashi Tharoor, Siddaramaiah In Attendance
content: Congress National President Mallikarjun Kharge on Saturday chaired a meeting of the Congress Working Committee at the All India Congress Committee headquarters in New Delhi.

title: Chinese Train Breaks World Record, Hits 700 Kmph In Just Two Seconds
content: The train floats above the track using superconducting magnets that lift it and push it forward without actually touching the rails.

title: Medical Services Hit Across Himachal Pradesh Amid Doctors' Indefinite Strike
content: Medical services, barring emergency services, were severely affected across several hospitals in Himachal Pradesh as resident doctors went on an indefinite strike against the termination of services of a doctor who entered into a brawl with a patient

title: Congress Leader Shares AI Pic Of Pinarayi Vijayan With Sabarimala Accused, Taken Into Custody
content: A Congress leader was taken into custody for allegedly sharing an AI-generated photograph depicting Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan along with Unnikrishnan Potty, an accused in the Sabarimala gold case.

title: 660 Arrests In 24 Hours: Big 'Op Aaghat' Crackdown In Delhi Before New Year
content: Hundreds of accused have been arrested in an overnight crackdown in Delhi as the national capital gears up for New Year celebrations.

title: Kash Patel Says FBI's Aging Headquarters To Shut Down Permanently
content: FBI Director Kash Patel said the agency's historic-but-aging headquarters in Washington would be "shut down permanently" as he shifts personnel into the building once occupied by the now-defunct US Agency for International Development.

title: Not Satya Nadella Or Sundar Pichai, This CEO Tops Hurun India Rich List
content: Jayshree Ullal has a net worth of Rs 50,170 crore, positioning her ahead of high-profile Silicon Valley contemporaries and making her the richest Indian professional manager globally.

title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree To Ceasefire After Weeks Of Fierce Clashes
content: Thailand and Cambodia agreed on Saturday to halt weeks of fierce border clashes, the worst fighting in years between the Southeast Asian countries that has included fighter jets sorties, exchange of rocket fire and artillery barrages.

title: Injuries On Body, Undergarments Missing: Woman On Rape By Udaipur CEO
content: The gang rape of a woman IT firm manager in a car in Rajasthan's Udaipur has led to shocking revelations. The incident took place on December 20.

title: Who Is James, 'Bheegi Bheegi' Singer Whose Concert Was Attacked In Bangladesh
content: Over 25 people were reportedly injured in the incident that comes amid growing concerns over assaults on artists, performers, and cultural institutions across Bangladesh.

title: No Phones, Shorts For Children: UP Panchayat Guidelines To Protect 'Culture'
content: A khap Panchayat in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat district has issued guidelines banning smartphones for teenagers and half-pants for both boys and girls, citing concerns about "Western influence" and cultural values.

title: Customs Issues High Alert As Fraudsters Pose As Officials At Bengaluru Airport
content: The Customs department at the Bengaluru airport issued a high alert for the public after detecting a fraud racket in which impostors posing as Customs officials are cheating people and extorting money from them.

title: Drunk Delhi Woman Arrested For Hitting Police Barricade, Injuring Constable
content: A 40-year-old inebriated woman has been arrested after her car rammed into a police barricade and injured a constable on duty in outer north Delhi's Shahbad Dairy area.

title: Newly Built Ropeway Collapses During Trial In Bihar
content: The incident occurred when the ropeway from Rohtas block to Rohtasgarh Fort and Rohiteshwar Dham gave way along with an attached tower.

title: Shimla hospital assault: Himachal medical services hit as doctors go on strike
content: Resident doctors in Himachal Pradesh have launched an indefinite strike, halting non-emergency medical services across government hospitals. The protest follows the termination of a doctor accused of assaulting a patient, leading to significant hardship for patients, especially those from remote areas. Medical bodies are backing the doctor, demanding his reinstatement and a fair inquiry.

title: This day, that year: Dec 27, 1911 ‚Äî When ‚ÄòJana Gana Mana‚Äô was sung in Calcutta
content: Rabindranath Tagore's patriotic song, 'Jana Gana Mana' was sung publicly for the first time at a 1911 Congress session. It ultimately evolved into becoming India's National Anthem. Initially met with controversy regarding its inspiration, Tagore clarified it honored a timeless guiding spirit, not a monarch. Adopted in 1950 as the national anthem, "Jana Gana Mana" became a unifying national voice.

title: 'We are not into bulldozers': DKS vs Vijayan over demolition drive
content: Karnataka deputy chief minister DK Shivakumar has criticized Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan's remarks on a recent Bengaluru demolition drive. Shivakumar stated that senior leaders should understand ground realities before commenting, emphasizing the action was to protect public land from encroachers and land mafia, not targeting any community. He urged Vijayan to avoid making statements without full knowledge of the situation.

title: Israel approves, US does not: Why Somaliland recognition has triggered backlash
content: Israel's recognition of Somaliland as an independent state has sparked significant diplomatic backlash across Africa and the Middle East. This move reopens the debate over the de facto state, which declared independence from Somalia in 1991 and has its own government and institutions but lacks international recognition.

title: AI rewrites coding norms: Ex-Tesla AI director warns programmers are falling behind; sparks debate
content: Tesla's ex-AI chief, Andrej Karpathy, warns software engineers face a seismic shift as AI reshapes coding. He admits feeling behind, highlighting a new 'programmable layer' of AI tools. While some studies show mixed productivity gains, industry leaders like Google and Anthropic remain optimistic about AI's role in development.

title: Delhi homicide: Man kills wife for refusing to give Rs 20; later dies by suicide
content: A Delhi man allegedly strangled his wife during a dispute over a small sum of money before taking his own life by jumping in front of a train. Police initially faced conflicting accounts from the family, but an autopsy confirmed homicide. Investigations are ongoing into the husband's potential addiction and state of mind.

title: 15-year wait over! England beat Australia in chaotic fourth Test at MCG
content: England secured a crucial four-wicket victory in the fourth Ashes Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, marking their first win on Australian soil in 15 years. The match concluded within two days, with England chasing down a target of 175 to restore pride and build confidence for the final Test.

title: Google CEO shares AI-made Xmas photo: Elon Musk reacts; post goes viral
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai's AI-generated Christmas greeting featuring himself and his dog, Jeffree, in a custom snow globe image, garnered significant attention on X.

title: 'That Indian side wasn't great': Alastair Cook's brutal take on England's 2-2 series draw
content: Alastair Cook believes England's 2-2 draw against India, led by Shubman Gill, was against a "not a great Indian side." He expressed concern that this result masked underlying issues and potentially diverted focus from crucial series like the Ashes, where England are currently trailing Australia 0-3.

title: ‚ÄòOperation Aaghat 3.0‚Äô: Delhi Police arrest over 200 ahead of New Year, seize illegal weapons
content: Delhi Police conducted a massive overnight crackdown, detaining over 1,300 individuals to ensure a crime-free New Year. 'Operation Aaghat 3.0' saw hundreds arrested for various offenses, including arms and drug violations, while others were held preventively. Significant seizures of weapons, liquor, and stolen goods were made, bolstering city security.

title: Aadhaar-PAN linking: December 31 deadline, penalty of Rs 1,000; things to know
content: Urgent action is required for all PAN cardholders. The Income Tax Department has set December 31, 2025, as the final deadline to link your PAN with Aadhaar. Failure to comply will render your PAN card inoperative, leading to significant financial penalties and tax implications.  A Rs 1,000 late fee applies for those linking after the initial period.

title: Russia strikes Kyiv with missiles, drones; message for Trump ahead of Zelenskyy meet?
content: Kyiv was rocked by powerful explosions early Saturday as Russia launched missile and drone attacks across Ukraine. Air defenses were active, with authorities urging residents to seek shelter. This latest assault occurs as President Zelenskyy prepares to meet with US President Donald Trump to discuss a peace proposal aimed at ending the ongoing conflict.

title: Railway Budget 2026: Funding for Indian Railways likely to remain unchanged
content: Indian Railways' Gross Budgetary Support (GBS) for FY26-27 is expected to remain stable, with current allocations sufficient for infrastructure upgrades. While overall GBS may be steady, internal allocations will be rejigged to prioritize projects like the bullet train, track safety, and decongestion initiatives.

title: 'Forced to spend Rs 40 lakh on reception': Newlywed woman dies by suicide in Bengaluru
content: A 26-year-old newlywed woman, Ganavi, died after allegedly attempting suicide, with her family accusing her husband and his relatives of dowry harassment. The family staged a protest at the husband's home after her death, demanding the arrest of his family members. Police have registered a dowry death case and are searching for the absconding accused.

title: MEA says will bring back all ‚Äòfugitives‚Äô after Lalit Modi mocks govt
content: India is determined to bring back all fugitives wanted for prosecution. The Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal confirmed ongoing talks with multiple governments for extradition. Delays in cases like Vijay Mallya and Lalit Modi are due to complex legalities. India remains committed to ensuring these individuals face trial in Indian courts.

title: UPSC examination calendar 2026: Stay ready and check NDA, CDS, Civil Services dates here
content: The UPSC Examination Calendar 2026 is now available for aspirants to plan their preparation effectively. With exams like Civil Services, NDA, CDS, Engineering Services, CAPF, and IFS scheduled throughout the year, candidates can align their study schedule, revision, and mock tests accordingly. This detailed calendar includes notification dates, application deadlines, exam commencement dates, and duration for all major examinations and recruitment tests, helping candidates stay organized, focused, and fully prepared for success in 2026.

title: Gastroparesis vs irritable bowel syndrome: Key differences, symptoms and treatments
content: Digestive woes like gastroparesis and IBS, though distinct, cause similar discomfort. Gastroparesis slows stomach emptying, leading to nausea and early fullness. IBS impacts the intestines with cramps and bowel changes. Understanding their unique origins, symptoms, and triggers is vital for effective management and improved well-being through diet, lifestyle, and medical interventions.

title: Watch: 7k flower pots looted after PM Modi opens Rashtra Prerna Sthal in UP
content: Nearly 7,000 potted plants, valued at Rs10 lakh, were looted from the newly inaugurated Rashtra Prerna Sthal within 24 hours. Despite police presence, individuals were seen removing plants and leaving in vehicles. Authorities are now increasing security and relocating remaining plants to prevent further theft.

title: 'Under influence of alcohol': Fashion designer harassed in Bengaluru Metro
content: A fashion designer reported harassment on the Bengaluru Metro. The incident occurred near Vidhana Soudha Metro Station. Metro security detained the accused man. Police registered a non-cognisable report and issued a warning. The man was allegedly under the influence of alcohol. The woman later posted a video of the incident online.

title: 'Scolded over AI use during exam': Class 10 student dies by suicide in Greater Noida West
content: A 16-year-old student tragically died by suicide after allegedly being reprimanded by teachers for using AI on her phone during pre-Board exams. Her father has filed a police complaint accusing the Greater Noida school of abetment to suicide. The school principal stated the student was informed of potential suspension for cheating, denying harassment.

title: Startups in 2025: Fewer closures but big names stumble ‚Äî BluSmart, Dunzo & others exit
content: India's startup scene experienced a stable year in 2025 with fewer shutdowns.  However, notable companies like BluSmart, Dunzo, and Hike Messaging ceased operations.  The decline in closures reflects a broader trend across the ecosystem.  This shift offers a new landscape for emerging ventures.

title: ‚ÄòBack to business‚Äô: FMCG engine stabilises operations after GST 2.0; companies expect 'strong demand' ahead
content: Consumer goods companies are stabilizing operations after GST rate cuts, with supply chains and inventory levels returning to normal. Production has resumed at full capacity as firms rebuild stock to meet anticipated demand. Executives expect a demand recovery and sales growth from the next quarter onwards.

title: 'Issues with Ram': Anurag Thakur jibes opp over VB-GRAM-G; predicts Cong''century of defeats'
content: BJP MP Anurag Thakur criticized Congress for opposing the VB-G RAM-G act, 2025, alleging their objection stems from the word 'Ram'. He highlighted increased employment days and funding under the new bill, questioning Congress's past naming conventions for rural employment schemes.

title: Massive! Deepti Sharma smashes records, becomes first Indian cricketer to ...
content: Deepti Sharma achieved a historic milestone in the third T20I against Sri Lanka, becoming the third-highest wicket-taker in women's international cricket and the first Indian to claim 150 T20I wickets. She also became the first cricketer globally to score 1,000 runs and take 150 wickets in T20 Internationals.

title: Engaged to another woman, nurse kills 39-year-old woman in Bengaluru
content: A 39-year-old contract nurse was allegedly murdered by her 25-year-old lover, also a nurse at the same hospital, following an argument over marriage. The accused reportedly attacked the victim with a surgical blade at her rented house after she threatened to expose their relationship. He was later taken into custody after CCTV footage and call records raised suspicion.

title: Bangladesh concert attack: Bricks thrown at show of 'Bheegi Bheegi' singer James; 15-20 students injured
content: A concert by Bangladeshi rock star James was cancelled in Faridpur. The event turned violent when outsiders attempted to enter the venue. They threw bricks and stones, injuring at least 25 people, including students. Organisers expressed confusion about the motive behind the attack. The deputy commissioner instructed the cancellation of the performance.

title: Shilpa Shetty wins personality rights case against AI-generated content
content: The Bombay High Court has issued a strong directive, ordering social media platforms to immediately remove AI-generated and morphed images of actor Shilpa Shetty, deeming them "extremely disturbing." The court emphasized the violation of her fundamental right to privacy and reputation, extending protection to personality rights.

title: Video: Israeli settler drives ATV into Palestinian kneeling for prayer
content: An Israeli settler, who is a reserve soldier, driving an ATV into a Palestinian man kneeling in prayer near the village of Deir Jarir, north of Ramallah in the West Bank. Following the incident, the IDF confirmed the soldier‚Äôs identity, confiscated his weapon, and suspended his service. The suspect was later arrested and placed under house arrest for five days.

title: Between two Indias: Life on the 2025 feed
content: In 2025, the Indian "scroll" is a journey through two worlds on one screen: a filtered India of aesthetic luxury and a raw India of everyday labor. As affordable data and smartphones bring 500 million users online‚Äîmostly from Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities‚Äîthe distance between these lives has collapsed.

title: 'India should change its stand': Hindus form party in Bangladesh; hope to win 40-45 seats in polls
content: A newly registered Bangladesh Minority Janta Party (BMJP) aims to contest 91 seats in the upcoming elections, targeting Hindu and minority votes. The party's president seeks alliances with mainstream parties like BNP or Jamaat-e-Islami to ensure minority safety and participation, advocating for a secular Bangladesh and protection of Hindu rights.

title: Salman holds father Salim's hand to cut b'day cake ‚Äî watch
content: Bollywood icon Salman Khan celebrated his 60th birthday with a lavish party at his Panvel farmhouse.  A touching moment saw the star, clean-shaven and casually dressed, cutting his cake alongside his father, veteran screenwriter Salim Khan, with brother Sohail Khan offering support.  Family members, including his mother Salma and siblings, joined the heartfelt celebration, creating a memorable milestone.

title: Silver price today: White metal soars 9% to record high; gold, platinum & others follow
content: Silver prices have surged to a record high, outperforming gold with a staggering 158% rise over the past year. This rally, fueled by tight supply, industrial demand, and anticipated Federal Reserve rate cuts, has propelled other precious metals like gold, platinum, and palladium to new peaks. Analysts foresee continued upward momentum, with silver potentially reaching $90 and gold nearing $5,000.

title: Border clashes: Thailand and Cambodia agree to 'immediate' ceasefire; second this year
content: Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to an immediate ceasefire, ending weeks of deadly border clashes. The joint statement, effective December 27, 2025, covers all weapon types and targets. This agreement follows intensified violence after a previous ceasefire collapsed, despite earlier US-brokered peace efforts.

title: 'Rs 763 for 28 deliveries': Raghav Chadha invites Blinkit delivery partner for lunch
content: A Blinkit delivery executive, whose viral video exposed meager daily earnings, met Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chadha. Chadha had previously raised concerns in Parliament about gig worker conditions, including low pay and lack of social security. The delivery partner shared his daily struggles with long hours and unpredictable income.

title: Clavicular claims self-defense after disturbing Cybertruck livestream incident
content: A controversial livestream featuring streamer Clavicular has sparked outrage after footage showed his Tesla Cybertruck moving forward with a person on its hood on Christmas Eve. Clavicular claims fear drove his actions, alleging he believed individuals surrounding his vehicle were armed. The incident has raised serious questions about online accountability and real-world danger.

title: Kuwait announces January 1 as public holiday for New Year 2026
content: Kuwait‚Äôs Civil Service Commission has announced January 1, 2026, as a public holiday, giving government employees a three-day New Year weekend through Saturday, January 3. Work will resume on Sunday, January 4. While most government offices will close, entities with special operational needs may adjust schedules to ensure essential services continue, allowing residents and officials to celebrate the New Year with minimal disruption.

title: Lifting weights with glasses on? Ophthalmologist says it can be riskier than you think
content: Ophthalmologist Dr Sanskriti Ukey warns against lifting weights with high power glasses.  This activity can cause a dangerous pressure spike in the eyes.  Such pressure can lead to retinal tears or detachment.  Retinal detachment is a serious condition requiring surgery.  It can result in permanent vision loss.  Protecting your vision is paramount.  Consider lighter weights or alternative methods for lifting.

title: 'Year of tariff consequences': Global trade in 2026 ‚Äî another rough patch ahead?
content: Global trade faces a turbulent 2026 as US tariffs reshape flows, impacting American imports while boosting others. The USMCA faces review, and shipping could see disruption from Red Sea route reopening and potential US economic acceleration. New trade deals lack enforcement, raising concerns about their durability amid international objections.

title: MS Dhoni at Salman Khan birthday party: Fans chant 'Mahi bhai' - Watch
content: Mahendra Singh Dhoni's rare public appearance at Salman Khan's birthday bash highlighted his enduring fan appeal.  Dhoni will return for IPL 2026 with Chennai Super Kings, who invested heavily in uncapped talents like Kartik Sharma. Sharma expressed his excitement about playing alongside Dhoni, calling it a dream come true after a significant auction bid.

title: Mysterious death in Tirupati: Suspended professor found dead in parked car; probe under way
content: A suspended Sri Venkateswara University professor, V Sardar Gugloth, was found dead in a decomposed state inside a parked car near Alipiri. He had been suspended three months prior due to alcohol addiction and irregular attendance. Police are investigating the exact cause of death, suspecting he died several days ago.

title: Delhi air pollution: AQI slips to 'Very Poor' as smog engulfs city; crosses 300 mark
content: Delhi woke up to severe fog and smog on Saturday, with pollution levels reaching dangerous highs in several areas. Calm winds trapped pollutants, worsening air quality to 'Very Poor' and 'Severe' categories. Vehicular emissions and NCR districts were identified as major contributors to the pollution load.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: the transfer window opens in early January across the premier league , german Bundesliga , French Ligue 1 , Spanish LaLiga and Italian Serie A . but clubs have been busy planning their business for months . arsenal's summer spend was so comprehensive that they now have the best squad depth in England .

title: Can Jalen Hurts or Josh Allen break the career rushing TD record?
content: the Philadelphia Eagles host the Buffalo Bills at the etihad stadium on tuesday . the game features two of the most prolific rushing quarterbacks of all time . if their bodies cooperate and the stars align, what they're capable of achieving would be epic .

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: DFS and Pick 6 plays: Week 17's biggest decisions to make, top stacks and more
content: Daily Fantasy is approaching week 17 for the DraftKings Sunday nine-game main slate . pick 6 Tyler Fulghum on the optimal lineup build given slate dynamics to maximize your floor and upside . the best pick 6 options are going to condense around three options .

title: One stat that will make or break 2026 for all 15 NL teams
content: we're going to pick one stat from the 2025 season for each MLB team . we'll start with the national league and then return with the American League . 17 different pitchers recorded a save for the Diamondbacks .

title: Betting lines for each CFP quarterfinal matchup
content: the quarterfinals will be played on Dec. 31 and Jan. 1, then the semifinals on Jan. 8 and 9 leading up to the title game . a 78% probability to win game outright Rate Bowl New Mexico at Minnesota -1.5 Friday, Dec. 26, 4:30 p.m.

title: Grading coaching hires: Kyle Whittingham, Michigan agree to deal
content: the wildest college football coaching cycle -- perhaps ever -- has reached the hiring phase . watch your favorite events in the newly enhanced ESPN App . sign up now New hires always come with hope and optimism, grand proclamations and the chance to get programs on right track .

title: Protest outside HC against bail given to former MLA in Unnao rape case
content: rape survivor and her mother attended the protest outside gate number 5 . a few protesters left the spot within an hour after warnings by police . the protest was attended by women's rights activist Yogita Bhayana .

title: Snap reactions to every Week 17 game: Broncos stay in control of AFC destiny; Cowboys, Vikings win
content: the Broncos are 20-13 ahead of the Chiefs . the Vikings beat the Lions in the playoffs on christmas day . their hopes of earning the AFC's top seed alive have been reacted to the action .

title: 'If I don‚Äôt get this right, my career is over': How Penn State landed on Matt Campbell as its next coach
content: Matt Campbell is new coach for the first time in 58 days as head coach . the 46-year-old had become Iowa State's all-time coaching wins leader . he had spent much of his childhood following Nittany Lions football while visiting grandparents .

title: NBA buzz: Live updates, trades and intel from around the league
content: the trade deadline is Feb. 5 at 3 p.m. ET, and we have you covered on all the buzz around the league as the 2025-26 season heats up . the unofficial kick off to trade season happened on Dec. 15, with nearly 90% of players becoming eligible to be moved -- it'll get only hotter from here .

title: Indian Army, Assam Rifles conduct joint drill in Arunachal's Changlang
content: ‚ÄúThe drill focused on speed, coordination, and precision to ensure smooth execution under near-real conditions,‚Äù Defence spokesperson Lt .Col. Mahendra Rawat said in the statement

title: Pushpa 2 stampede case: Allu Arjun named among 23 in charge sheet
content: The actor and the other accused were subjected to several rounds of questioning during the course of the probe

title: SIR hearings begin in Bengal, 32 lakh 'unmapped' voters to be covered
content: ‚ÄúAround 32 lakh ‚Äòunmapped‚Äô voters, those who are unable to establish linkage with the 2002 electoral roll, will be called for hearings in the first phase,‚Äù says senior official

title: Chamarajanagar district‚Äôs first Government Law College inaugurated
content: The inauguration of the Government Law College in Chamarajanagar comes months after permission was issued by the Bar Council of India earlier this year following an appeal made by present MP Sunil Bose

title: Freezing Munnar attracts Christmas-New Year tourists
content: Letchmi recorded 2¬∞C, and Silent Valley recorded 3¬∞C, matching the previous seasonal low of -1¬∞C at Sevenmallay on Dec. 20

title: PM Rashtriya Bal Puraskar winners: check full list
content: Young prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, and two posthumous recipients from Tamil Nadu and Bihar are in this year‚Äôs Bal Puraskar list.

title: Overall crime in Hyderabad drops 15% in 2025; offences against women, children rise
content: The data released by the Hyderabad city police that total number of cases registered under core criminal laws, special local laws, and other statutes dropped to 30,690 in 2025 from 35,944 in 2024

title: Tej Pratap alleges death threats from expelled party leader, writes to Samrat for enhanced security
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, in his police complaint, also alleged that after the expulsion, Santosh Renu Yadav started abusing and issuing death threats to him on social media platforms. Despite repeated attempts, Santosh Renu Yadav could not be contacted

title: Kerala‚Äôs Opposition Leader V. D Satheesan calls CM Pinarayi Vijayan an autocrat
content: He further alleged that CPI(M)‚Äôs cyber cell has been engaged in constant personal attacks against senior Congress leaders, including Priyanka Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi

title: Actor Sivaji appears before Telangana women‚Äôs panel over remarks
content: The Commission took suo motu cognisance of Sivaji‚Äôs comments made at the pre release event of his film Dandora, where he spoke about women‚Äôs clothing choices

title: Brawl at IGMC Shimla: Doctors go on indefinite strike; medical services hit in Himachal
content: Doctors demand reinstatement of Dr. Narula and a transparent, time-bound and impartial inquiry into the incident

title: Congress chief Kharge calls for nationwide campaign against MGNREGA repeal
content: Speaking at the Congress Working Committee meeting in New Delhi, Mr. Kharge also said that the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls was a ‚Äúwell-planned conspiracy‚Äù to limit democratic rights

title: AAP announces debut in Bhiwandi, Navi Mumbai civic polls
content: ‚Äú Aam Aadmi Party has completed the initial screening of candidates for 30 out of the 90 seats in the Bhiwandi-Nizampur Municipal Corporation,‚Äù says AAP Bhiwandi unit's president

title: Woman raped on agri university campus in Jabalpur; two held
content: The police arrested Durga Shankar Singerha (58), an upper division clerk (UDC), and Mukesh Sen, a peon, in connection with the assault that took place on the campus of the Jawaharlal Nehru Agricultural University.

title: Punjab, Haryana reel under intense cold; Sonamarg coldest at minus 5.8 degrees Celsius
content: Srinagar recorded a minimum temperature of minus 2.6 degrees Celsius on Friday night, nearly three degrees down from 0.2 degrees Celsius on the previous night, they said.

title: Bengal govt officers' association raises concern over voter deletions in draft rolls under SIR
content: The deletions can be made in cases when "the person concerned has ceased to be ordinarily resident in the constituency or that he is otherwise not entitled to be registered in the electoral roll of that constituency", it said

title: CEC begins 3-day Odisha tour, calls BLOs 'pillars of election process'
content: Before concluding his visit, Mr. Kumar will interact with around 700 BLOs from Khurda and Cuttack districts on December 29 in Bhubaneswar

title: Discarded fishing gear piles up on Tamil Nadu coast as recycling infrastructure lags
content: A study shows fishing-related debris such as abandoned or lost nets, ropes, and floats makes up nearly half of the litter found on surveyed beaches

title: Defamatory post: Congress leader in police custody
content: He had already been booked under various sections of the BNS for the defamatory post against Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan

title: Centre's green panel gives nod to Dulhasti hydel power project on Chenab River
content: Expert Appraisal Committee on hydel projects accorded approval during its 45th meeting earlier this month, paving the way for the floating of construction tenders for the run-of-the-river project, estimated to cost over ‚Çπ3,200 crore

title: Tsunami anniversary: T.N. fishermen reiterate demand for Scheduled Tribe status
content: Community leader Durai Mahendran said that without reservation, the community has remained socially and educationally backward, with no IAS officers or judges from among its members

title: Eight militants arrested in Manipur
content: ‚ÄúFour members of the proscribed KCP (People's War Group) were apprehended from Andro Leitanpekpham area in Imphal East district on December 25,‚Äù says senior police officer

title: BJP leader threatens legal action for implicating him in Ankita Bhandari murder case
content: In a video message released by the state BJP on Friday (December 26), Mr. Gautam, the party affairs in-charge for Uttarakhand, claimed that no such allegations were levelled against him in his 47 years of public life.

title: 19 Bangladesh nationals among 511 arrested in Uttarakhand‚Äôs three districts under Operation Kalnemi
content: Those arrested included 19 Bangladeshis illegally residing in the State, of whom 10 have been sent back to the neighbouring country, while action is underway against the other nine, the statement said.

title: Committed to bringing back fugitives who fled India: Govt.
content: The assertion by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) came days after Lalit Modi, in a video posted on social media, joked about his and Mallya‚Äôs status as the ‚Äútwo biggest fugitives‚Äù of India

title: IndiGo flight disruptions: Panel submits probe report to DGCA
content: The inquiry committee, headed by DGCA Joint Director General Sanjay K Bramhane, was constituted on December 5 to conduct a comprehensive review and assessment of the circumstances that led to the massive flight disruptions

title: AIADMK extends last date for submission of applications for party ticket to contest poll
content: Two former Ministers C.Ve. Shanmugam and K. Pandiarajan are contemplating changing their constituencies

title: CPI seeks compensation or return of land to farmers in Eluru district
content: Party says 340 acres acquired in 2016 for proposed aircraft components unit remain unused, leaving farming families in financial distress, urges government to act immediately

title: The quiet, deserted meadows of Kashmir
content: Only 28 of the 48 destinations in the Kashmir Valley that were closed after the terror attack in Pahalgam have been reopened. While waiting for the Lieutenant Governor to give clearance to the rest to resume operations, locals who are dependent on tourism for their livelihoods worry about unpaid loans and unsteady jobs. Peerzada Ashiq reports on how the incident continues to impact tourism

title: Rabri Devi may vacate official bungalow after month of Kharmas
content: Videos of pick-up vans full of household belongings making exit from Rabri Devi‚Äôs official bungalow suggest she may vacate it after inauspicious month of Kharmas

content: The Students also alleged that they are forced to do the work which they are not supposed to do like brooming the class, opening the gate, washing their own plates and glasses after mid-day meal and shutting the doors¬†and windows after the classes get over

title: Toddler dies after falling into water tank near Gudiyatham
content: The family checked the CCTV footage of the house and found that the toddler was walking towards the water tank

title: Andhra Pradesh reported 8,200 fatal¬†and¬†10,600¬†non-fatal accidents in 2025

title: Government fails to define Aravallis despite over a year‚Äôs effort

title: Officials suspended over temple construction on govt. land in West Godavari district

title: Call to protect biodiversity-rich underwater ecosystem off Thiruvananthapuram coast

title: CBI moves Supreme Court against bail to Sengar in Unnao rape case; protests continue

title: Ruhullah warns of protest over reservation issue in J&K

title: Irradiation centre near Hyderabad airport will help fruit farmers cut down damage and transportation cost
